choices: Be stopped by the strange gurgling of his stomach.
Be visited by a ghost of his past that he knows oh so well.
13.content: The god of Hyperdeath! The strong god that had been keeping his form, the strong, masterfull goat sat uppon the empty throne that he had, the only other person that was currently down there was Frisk, who had been able to avoid his fighting. The super strong goat kept his days on the throne, using his magic, and letting the kids and monsters mostly stir his feelings and his options, though he was in controll. Today however, would start him up with heading to bed
13.title: Asriel in his Hyperdeath Form.

choices: Ask the human for more food
131.content:
Almost immediately after he shut his eyes, Asriel’s abdomen began gurgling. Nothing serious, he supposed, but it had been over a century since he last had a body. There were a lot of things he’d forgotten about being an actual, living Boss Monster. His first thoughts were that perhaps the human, Chara, had done something. A small amount of fear struck him, before he calmed down. He thought rationally, if they really could do something to harm or injure him, it would’ve happened on the outside, not the inside. This was more so of a emptiness, a missing component that was vital to his survival. And what was worse is that he didn’t know what it was, but it felt like it was moving inside him. Shuddering at the thought of what it could be, he spotted the human messing around with a… What even was that? A metal container? A weapon? Increasingly curious, he went over, hiding himself in the void. Looking from over the human’s shoulder, it looked like… a bunch of weird white strings floating around in weirdly colored water. He was about to go away disappointed, but… The smell that the inside of the metal thing was emitting… It was irresistible. The smell flooded his nose, making him think of something essential. Yes. He needed this. And he had to take it without the human noticing. Unfortunately for him and his plan, his abdomen started making the strange noises again, this time louder than the first. Chara noticed almost immediately, and turned their head towards Asriel, staring right at his abdomen. The noises continued. Wondering what it was, they looked at the empty throne, then back at Asriel's hidden form. They had figured out his trick. Turning back towards the metal container, they turned a switch from underneath, and flames Asriel hadn't noticed earlier disappeared. Preparing their weapon, Asriel thought. Revealing himself, Chara wasn't surprised. Grabbing the handle of the metal container, they lifted it and began moving it towards Asriel. Immediately he began preparing an attack, bracing himself for whatever the human threw at him.

Frisk was confused. They heard Asriel's stomach rumble, why was he going to attack them? They did plan to eat the noodles themselves, but hearing Asriel nearby, they were friendly enough to have him eat them instead to sate his hunger. They stared at his face curiously, wondering if he was going to attack them or not.

Realizing that the human wasn't attacking, he put his hands down, wanting to know what they were doing with the container’s contents. They handed him a metal partially-flat stick. Well, stick wasn’t the most accurate term to describe it. It was curved at the handle, splitting into a four pronged trident. It was very small, it couldn’t even be considered a weapon. They pulled one of their own out, and set the metal container down. Poking through the contents, the human pulled a bunch of the strings out, the colored water dripping off of it, the steam billowing from the strings and water alike, making their way to Asriel’s nose and causing his abdomen to make more strange noises. The human blew on the strings, before bringing them to their mouth. Confused and fascinated by what they were doing, Asriel did the same, putting the strings into his mouth, only to find himself biting down on the strings, a marvelous flavor spreading through it, and then he swallowed. He was speechless. He hadn’t remembered what eating was like, and yet, there was an entire container almost full of food. Asriel decided to take it, and disappeared to his throne with it, downing the entire thing at once. Unfortunately, his fun didn’t last long, seeing as his container was empty.
131.title: What is This?

14.content:
The barrier is broken and humans and monsters can live at peace. Asriel was given a second chance at life. All of the monsters could see a long road ahead of them, this was the next chapter.

Everybody has finally gotten used to the changes but, how long has it been since the barrier broke.
14.title: A second chance

141.content:
Asriel couldn’t remember anything so sincere to him like his sibling. At least, as of today. Of course, that sort of had to do with him getting a Soul a while ago, just as the barrier broke. He could remember it like yesterday...

When the Barrier was broken, Frisk was sad to see Asriel go. Unable to see him suffer, they took out their Soul, and before Asriel could even react, it was forced into him. A smile formed on their face as their consciousness began to fade away.

This couldn’t be happening. NO! He had just gotten to know their name, Frisk couldn’t just die! In a burst of grief, a large amount of magic launched itself out of Asriel’s new Soul, latching itself upon Frisk’s body. Asriel felt unchanged, but he knew something was off about his new Soul, and that had nothing to do with the fact that it was human. As if a half of him was somewhere else. He glanced over to their body, and froze once he saw what had happened to it.

Frisk began stirring, confused as to how they were still alive. They had given up their Soul, had they not? Their Determination had been inherited by Asriel, causing them to lose all control over the timeline. Is it possible that they were alive without any Soul to keep them anchored? Were they some sort of zombie? There wasn’t any way of knowing for sure while lying on the ground, so they attempted to get up. However, they were too weak to even do that, just barely able to twitch their fingers.

Asriel stepped away from their now moving body, shocked as to what had happened to it. He didn’t know what surprised him more, the fact that they were alive, or the changes that had happened to their body. Despite that, he eventually came to his senses, going to Frisk’s side slowly and helping them up, anxiously wondering what their reaction would be…

With Asriel helping them up, Frisk could only weakly smile in return, hoping it would convey the message of thanks. Although, they did wonder why Asriel looked scared and worried. The answer came to them soon enough when they tried to take a few steps, wobbling under their feet. Even in their weakened state, they didn’t know why it was so hard to just place one foot in front of the other. It felt impossible, but with their hair in the way, they couldn’t see what was going on. Making a few attempts to move it out of the way, they finally managed to do so, and their first thought was that they were sharing Asriel’s body. But if that was the case, why was his fur brown, and how was he carrying them at the same time? The answer came to them slowly, but Frisk pieced it together.

A bleat of fear escaped Asriel’s not so human friend. Setting them down, they stared at themselves in shock, not knowing how this happened or why. They shouldn’t even be alive at this point, how were they transformed to look like a brown furred boss monster? They attempted to take their Soul out, but they couldn’t. Asriel, wondering what they were doing, asked, to which they explained about trying to take out their Soul, like they did when they were… still… human…

That explains it.

Asriel was confused for a few seconds, before coming to the same conclusion that Frisk had. Frisk had somehow transformed into a fully fledged Boss Monster. Either that or they were a zombie, though that didn’t explain the transformation. Still, both were happy that they were together, alive at least, and looked forwards to facing the next challenge that life threw at them.

One Year Later...
141.title: A Connection

1411.content:
The evening had arrived, and there was already a competition underway. Today seemed very exciting for the Dreemurr family.

Already though his fifth pie, Asriel was only one away from catching up to Frisk, who was already starting on their seventh. Despite his belly protesting that he was full, Asriel pushed onward, shoveling slice after slice into his maw and swallowing just as fast. Frisk, however, was able to keep up the pace, maintaining a relatively safe lead in the competition. Toriel and Asgore looked on in anticipation, wondering who would win, Toriel applauding Frisk on, while Asgore was rooting for Asriel.

Frisk had reached their ninth pie, while Asriel was stuck on his eighth. Once finishing it, Frisk had moved on to the last pie on their side of the table, victory in reach, just needing to stuff themself with one last pie to win this battle. Asriel had just finished his, victory far from the clutches of his claws. Unless...

Desperate times called for desperate measures, and Asriel took them. He had this planned for a while now, but he had never attempted it before. Of course, neither has anyone else, he would be the first to do so. Grabbing an entire pie tin, he tilted his head back and held the pie above it. Then, he dropped it, bracing himself for the taste of metal and snails. The pie was trapped in his maw, and after a few gags, Asriel finally steeled himself to push it to the back of their mouth using his hand and swallowed. A large bulge traveled down his throat, through his chest, and settled into his belly. Even Frisk paused to see what had happened.

After a few seconds of rubbing his throat, the metal having scratched the insides of his mouth and throat, Asriel was too determined to let a small amount of pain stop him from winning. He held up the last pie, tilting his head back again. Frisk looked on in understanding as the competition resumed. Asriel dropped the pie in, ready to swallow it. This time, he didn’t gag, although he did have some trouble swallowing the pie itself. Frisk took this opportunity to catch up, leaving one last slice. They quickly grabbed it and gobbled it up, just as Asriel had swallowed his tenth pie. It was too close to see with the naked eye. Thankfully, there was video evidence to see who had swallowed before the other. The only question that remained was, who was first?

All four goats were examining the footage, and although it was very close, the slow mo studied by the judges, Asgore and Toriel (who had promised to be impartial), a winner was decided. The two competitors were called to the table, sitting down next to each other, guts hard at work on digesting the ten consumed snail pies. Asgore then stood in between them, holding one of their hands at his side, while Toriel made a big show of announcing who won this battle “And the winner of the Snail Pie Eating Competition is....” She made a makeshift drumroll on the table.

“Asriel!” Asgore lifted his son’s hand as high up as it could go while Asriel was seated, a clear smile of victory on his face. Once their hand was let go, Frisk offered theirs to Asriel, and both shook, a good sign of sportsmanship on their behalf. They weren’t upset at their defeat, for they would have plenty more chances to win in the end. This was only day one of the food competition they had set up. There were still six more opportunities to crush Asriel this week, and the last one would be on the date that they became a boss monster, celebrating one whole year of monsterkind freedom.

Asriel had gotten off the seat and begun waddling over to his room, and closed the door behind him, laying on his bed as a food coma began to overtake him, dozing off to the thoughts of a pie belly to play with afterwards, as well as wondering what the next six competitions were. Whatever would happen, he sure would enjoy it.
1411.title: Eating Competition: Day 1

choices: Successfully smuggle the extra biscuits onto Asriel's plate
1412.content:
Being on the surface had many appealing things. Sunlight, changing weather, fields and lakes to play with others, different foods from other cultures, even other hidden monster civilizations already having integrated into human society, discovered thanks to Frisk and Asriel. Despite everything, some things just never change for some. Frisk was a perfect example of this.

Frisk never liked having tacos, at least not as a monster. And even before that, they always saw them as too greasy. They never bothered to say anything about it though, as to not hurt Toriel’s feelings. Besides, it wasn’t all too bad. The shell and toppings usually absorbed it, although Toriel was known to go a little overboard with the meat occasionally. There wasn’t much to do at that point except eat it all, being a boss monster.

A small fact about boss monsters. They had a naturally large appetite for food, a little more than double a human’s average capacity. And Frisk, not wanting to miss out on any growth spurts the future might have, had to adjust to eating more over the last year. They succeeded, although they had to find out the hard way that some of their previously favorite foods had changed in flavor and texture. Like how cinnamon was more notable in flavor, and how chewy candy seemed to stick to their teeth more often than not.

They knew they had to eat most of the tacos to maintain a health weight, but… Leaving one or two to the side wouldn’t hurt, right? Where to put it though as to not attract suspicion..? An idea occurred to them.

When none of the other goats were looking, Frisk quickly put one of their tacos onto Asriel’s plate. They put one more, and then ate the rest, hoping they wouldn’t be caught. Being the heavy eating boss monster that he is, Asriel either didn’t notice or didn’t care. Either way, once dinner was finished, not a single morsel was left on anyone’s plate.

Frisk was curious however. Asriel had eaten all of his tacos, plus the two extra Frisk had placed in front of him. Something told them that wasn’t his limit. In the nearly one year of being a boss monster themself, they had never considered using their own body as a test subject. But yet, there it was, the unknowingly perfect subject to try it on. Sure, it would take a lot of planning and covering up their tracks, but if done well, they’d figure out what a boss monster’s limit is.

A few days of planning later, and Frisk was ready to start testing out Asriel’s full capacity. First, came breakfast. They had considered a lot of things, and hopefully, nothing could decimate their plan. If it did flop, or even backfire, they’d just improvise the best they can and go from there. As three of the goats sat down, Toriel brought over a platter full of freshly baked biscuits, setting it in the middle of the table. Once all of them were sitting down, they began stacking biscuit after biscuit on their plates, Frisk making sure to grab five extra. It was time to start.

How does Frisk’s plan unfold?
1412.title: Large Appetites

14121.content:
Frisk had thought of a lot of things. Such as what happens when the food isn’t something Asriel particularly likes? Or what if there was already a large amount of food served? They had solutions to that, albeit a little weird, but solutions nonetheless. For now, they’d have to focus on phase one. Secretly placing extra food on his plate, especially without anyone’s knowledge. The minutes ticked by as the family ate their meal, Frisk placing the biscuits onto Asriel’s plate. Upon finishing their breakfast, they looked towards Asriel. His plate had three remaining, and he ate the last few biscuits without another thought.

This process repeated itself for the next few meals, all throughout the week. It worked, although it was fairly obvious Asriel had yet to reach his limit, seeing as there wasn’t any sort of sign pointing to that. It appeared that Phase Two would have to be put into effect.

Occasionally, when both kids were playing, Frisk called for snacks to be sent to them, and of course, they made sure they were Asriel’s favorites. Once the platter was emptied, mostly thanks to Asriel, they’d continue playing while the Toriel and Asgore were dealing with kingdom issues. This process repeated itself three times a day, until on Thursday, something incredible happened. Asriel himself asked for a second platter of snacks to be brought with the first. This excited Frisk, as it meant that Asriel did indeed have a lot of room, but about how much was the question.

For the next week, the average amount of platters brought to them in a day increased to 5, with some days reaching 6 total platters. And snacks weren't the only thing that changed. During mealtimes Asriel would ask for a little more each day, as if he wasn’t satisfied by the portions served to him, and that was including the extra food sneaked onto his plate. His appetite wasn’t the only thing to change either, as his thin figure had a small bump poking out from it. Asriel had begun to put on weight, but thankfully, it wasn’t noticeable in the slightest. It took Frisk watching Asriel change into his night clothes to recognize that he had a small belly from the experiment.

Despite that, Frisk still didn’t think that it was enough. Sure, it was working for the time being, but Asriel was putting on weight. Wouldn’t it be better to perhaps it was time to start Phase 3 and quickly reach his limit before either parent suspected?
14121.title: Unknowing Test Subject: Asriel

142.content:
Months has passed since the barrier broke and Asriel has put on some weight. Once weighing about 100 pounds Asriel now sported a decent sized gut and weighed 180 pounds. He had gone up a few shirt sizes even the XL he was wearing seemed a little tight. Asriel was starting to look like his dad but still was only a forth of his weight. Asgore put on a few pounds as well making most anybody look small in comparison.

Asriel woke up to the sound of his gut groaning for food. He got up and went to the kitchen to see if there was anything to eat. It was still very early in the morning. He browsed the fridge for a minute, grabbed some leftover pizza, and ate it. He ate 4 slices before he felt satisfied. After he finished eating he went back to his room and went back to sleep.

Asriel woke to the smell of bacon and eggs. His mom, Toriel, makes the most delicious food anybody has ever tasted. Asriel walked into the kitchen ready to eat some breakfast when he saw both his parents in the kitchen. It’s taken a while but his parents are actually starting to get along better.

“Morning” Toriel said. Asgore already had his face stuffed with food and wasn’t able to say anything.

“Hey, you leave anything for me? Looks like you ate most of it” Asriel said. Asgore swallowed what was in his mouth.

“Oh very funny, just cause I’ve gotten big makes you think that I eat all the food in the house. Well look at yourself, I’m not the only one that’s gotten bigger” Asgore said. Both Asriel and Asgore looked down at their fat guts and laughed. Asgores body jiggled with every laugh and Asriel had a little bit of a bounce in his gut.

Asriel made his plate and started eating. He couldn’t help but admire his dads massive gut, how big and soft it was. He wanted one just like it. These thoughts sparked something inside Asriel, he wanted to be bigger than his dad, he wanted more, he wanted to be bigger no matter what. but first he had to find a way to get bigger.
142.title: A few months

14212.title: Continue, she enjoys baking anyway.

1422.content:
After breakfast Asriel started wonder of what ways he could get fatter, he could just eat more but it would take forever to get to his dads size, so a new thought popped into his mind.

“MAGIC!” He said. He got out of his room, “I’m going for a walk” he said.

“Ok just be back before 8” Asgore said.

Asriel went outside and started walking towards the library, he knew that it had a few magical books that he could use. He got to the library and it was quite, never a lot of people here just the occasional guy or 2. The more magical books were stored in the back of the library. After a few minutes of looking he found what he was looking for.

“There it is, Magic Of The Body” Asriel said. He brought the book to the librarian ready to check out his book.

“Did you find everything you’re looking for” the librarian asked.

“Yes” Asriel said, handing her the book.

“Oh one of the magic ones. What do you plan on doing with this one?” she asked.

“Oh I. Uh...” Asriel didn’t really know what to say if someone asked what he was doing, but he didn’t want to admit that he wanted to get fatter. “Uh well you see...” he tried to say something, but he came short of words so he just looked down at his gut.

“Oh looking to take off a few pounds?” She asked.

“Uh, yeah” Asriel said, it was a complete lie but he didn’t want her to think he was weird.

“Well Ok. The book is due in a month” she said.

“Thank you” Asriel said. He rushed home with the book. He couldn’t wait to use it. Asriel finally got home, said hi to his parents, and went into his room. He sat at his desk and opened the heavy book. There were so many different spells, from being an inch taller to completely changing how your body looked, the book had everything. He finally found what he was looking for, a chapter of spells that make people gain weight. He skimmed through the pages and found a few spells that caught his eye.

“Maybe I’ll use...” he said.
1422.title: The library has a book of spells

choices: He's a weak caster, he barely managed a few pounds.
14221.content:
He read the book cafefully, he knew he was a somewhat proficient caster, but he did not want to risk going for something out of his league.
Even though he was exited, he managed to contain himself enough to read carefully through the spell.
It required some power, and he knew he was by no means weak, but this spell needed a rather large amount of power.

He prepared himself to cast the spell with all his might, as he chanted and danced around his room a thick cloud of sparks and smoke filled it.
The goat boy rushed to open his window while coughing, the smoke quickly left his room, when he caught a glimpse of himself in his mirror.
14221.title: Instant gain spell

choices: Just slightly bigger than Asgore, ~800 lbs.
A lot bigger, he maxed out the scale.
142212.content:
As the smoke left the room he turned to a mirror in his room.
This mirror showed him the image of a young but extremely wide goat.
"I did it!! I can't believe I did it! I'm finally bigger than dad!"
He celebrated, his jumping and dancing made the entire house shake.

He walked to his bathroom, awkwardly waddling as he was not used to his weight yet.
"Just how big did I get?"
He asked himself as he stepped on a scale
142212.title: He's stronger than he thought.

choices: Frisk casts a spell on Asriel
2 weeks pass and the book is due
14222.content:
Asriel found a spell, he read aloud, “this spell causes weight gain to the person it is cast on. The weight gain gets greater the longer the person is under its effect. The spell ends once the caster is satisfied with the results”. He chanted the spell and he couldn’t really see anything but he hoped it worked. He hid the book under his bed.

One week later.

Frisk was finally back from a trip, and she took notice to Asriels bigger gut. Asriel had actually put on 30 pounds in that week making his already tight shirt too small. His normal pants couldn’t even fit anymore, so he resorted to sweatpants.

Frisk knew Asriel had done something to get this much fatter so she looked around in their room. After a few minutes of searching she found the spell book. She thought of what to do with it, she could make Asriel fatter faster, or make him gain a few pounds right now. She decided against using it right now but she put it somewhere else to use later.

2 days pass

“Ok we will be gone for a few weeks, are you sure you guys can handle being alone for that long?” Toriel asked.

“No problem we got this” Asriel and Frisk said at the same time.

“Ok, we will be back as soon as we finish our vacation” Toriel said. With that she closed the door and Frisk and Asriel were the only people in the house for the next week or so. In those 2 days Asriel packed on 17 more pounds, the effects were getting stronger and will keep getting stronger.
14222.title: Gradual growth

142222.content:
Day by day Asriels clothes got tighter and tighter. On the third day since his parents left on vacation his gut has grown too much for his sweatpants, thankfully his dad had some larger clothes in his room. His whole body filled out with fat, and each day he weighed himself, 227, 238, 259, 296. Asriel ended up thinking that this was way to fast for his liking so he looked for another spell that was more linear gain.

Surprisingly he found one that fit what he wanted. The spell would make the person who it is cast on gain some weight set by the caster and would stack every day. The book gave some examples like, 1, 2, 3 and, 2, 4, 6. Asriel cast the spell on himself and set the starting weight at 3. Asriel watched the numbers slowly climb, 299, 305, 314...

Today the book was finally due and Asriel weighed a hefty 494 pounds. It was a miracle that he could easily move around and even more of a miracle is that the sweatpants haven’t even ripped. Asriel went into town that day and bought some essential things like much bigger clothes, he also brought the book with him to see if he could renew it.

Asriel got to the library and renewed the book. As he was leaving there was a shelf that had a sign in front of it that said FREE BOOKS. Asriel asked if he could take some books home and the librarian assured him that he could take as many as he liked.

He looked through the books and was surprised to see that there were quite a few magical books on the shelf. He grabbed as many as he could carry, put them in his car. He got home and set all of the books on the kitchen table.
142222.title: A different spell and more books

1422221.content:
Asriel decided to look through the books, some seemed more useful than others. He skimmed through the book titles.

“The Mind, Bending Reality, and Creation And Destruction” Asriel read aloud, “now which one should I use first”.
1422221.title: So many to choose from

14222211.content:
Even though Asriel just bought new clothes he knew they wouldn’t last. He found a few spell that made things out of thin air and he memorized them for when he needed bigger clothes. Asriel was tired after moving his almost 500 pound body around all day. He made his way to the couch and fell asleep.

The force created by Asriel sitting down almost broke the couch. He used his large, fluffy gut as a pillow. Frisk saw Asriel and she also used him as a warm, fluffy pillow.


Asriel and Frisk kept waiting for their parents return and just hung around the house. Asriel kept weighing himself every day as his body puffed up with fat. 530, 569, 611, 656, He watched the numbers grow more everyday. He already had to use the creation spell 3 times.

Asriel got a phone call from Toriel saying that something happened and they wouldn’t be able to come home for another 2 months. Asriel and Frisk couldn’t believe what was happening but they made due. A few more days have passed and Asriel neared 1000 pounds and became immobile. Asriel had to use the creation spell daily for new clothes.
14222211.title: Quickly escalating weight

choices: Frisk studied the weight spells Asriel used.
142222111.content:
The massive goat was really starting to like his new body, and with Frisk's help being immobile was not that bad either so he decided to keep on growing a while longer.
If anything happened, he reasoned, he could always find a spell to reverse this effect.

Frisk was happy to feed his new fat bed, and actually managed to convince a few other monsters to help with the increasingly difficult endeavor.
After a while they stopped bothering with clothes, he was outgrowing them too fast and no one seemed bothered by a bit of exposed fur.

Within a week he was already a tad over 1600 lbs, his feet now buried under a mound of lard and his head was starting to sink slightly when he laid back, he was starting to consider that perhaps this was a bit excessive, but frisk shoo'd those thoughts away by shoving another donut in his waiting maw.

As more townsfolk agreed to feed the goat-blob frisk found herself with a bit of free time, which she gladly used to clean the house.
Clearing some things out of the way of the growing lardball she found some of the spell books he got.
While she was not exactly a proficient spellcaster, she did not hesitate to try a few basic spells to try and impress her friend.

Now it's almost time for their mother to come back...
142222111.title: Asriel keeps growing

1422222.content:
It had been a busy day and the hefty goat needed some well deserved rest. So after leaving the books on the coffee table for later study he headed for his room to take a short nap.

A short while later there's a knock on the door, after knocking a couple of times Frisk decided to let themselves in. Made a cup of hot chocolate to warm up from the cold weather and sat in front of the TV for a while.
They noticed the books and curiosity got the best of them. Despite not being an experienced caster, they could understand a few of the more basic spells.
Frisk was quite interested in the book they picked, which was...
1422222.title: An unexpected guest

14222221.content:
Frisk found a couple of spells that not only seemed interesting but also easy enough for them to cast.
They figured that since their good friend Asriel had been gaining a lot of weight recently, they might get a bit of a sympathy weight.
Last time they saw the pudgy goat he was already over 200 lbs, so maybe a few extra pounds would do.
The thin human took a photo of a few pages of the spellbook before leaving, they wanted this to be a surprize (besides they would need new clothes for this).

It took a bit of practice to get it right, but after a couple of days of practice they finally did it. With a bit of Asriel's fur taken from the sofa they casted the spell that would make them...
14222221.title: The Book of Bodily Improvement

choices: He's really busy right now, maybe in a couple of days.
He can't really go out, but Frisk can visit any time he wants.
142222212.content:
They figured that if the goat was 200-and-something pounds, he must have gained 20 or 30 pounds in the last couple of months, but being both thinner and shorter, Frisk needed to gain a bit more than that to match. Maybe a 100 or so pounds would be enough, so they settled for gaining 4 times as fast.
Just as they were wrapping up, the thin human felt their belly press a bit against their shirt, "a job well done" they thought. so they went to bed.

The next morning something was off... Frisk felt awfully heavy, and had to pull a massive effort to get off their bed, even then, the jiggly mass that now was part of their body made it hard to keep their balance.
"Something must've gone wrong!" they thought as they quickly waddled to their bathroom. The mirror didn't lie, the once skinny human was now very fat, around 300 lbs.
Maybe they misread the spell... maybe they gained all the month's worth at once... there's no way little Assy could gain 50 pounds in a night, is it?.
Frisk quickly consulted the photos on their phone, read and reread the text, but everything seemed fine. Maybe they messed up the spell? probably, but they'd have to return to Asriel's place to find out... But they had no clothes! nothing in their closet was even close to this size.

Maybe they should call him instead? sounds like a good idea. Frisk called him, it took him a while to pick up, sounding groggy and sleepy.
After apologizing for waking him up they asked if he could visit.
142222212.title: gain faster than him.

choices: find a way to reverse this
14223.content:
Asriel flipped through page after page and he finally found something that sparked his interest. It was a simple spell that made the target gain weight exponentially. no information was given other than how to cast it and its brief explanation. Asriel cast the spell on himself and it would last a month and he waited for results.

Asriel thought that the spell was a failure until the morning of the 5th day since Asriel cast the spell. As for his usual routine he stepped on the scale and was surprised to see a 204 plastered on it. Asriels weight grew faster after that and he started eating more. each day his gut grew bigger. 231 pounds, 289 pounds, and 414 on the end of the 7th day. at this point he was starting to catch up with his dad. Asriels belly was the biggest part of him and it hung down just above his knees.

at the and of the 8th day Asriel was starting to get worried that he would turn into a blob. now weighing in at 677 pounds he now outweighed his father by a small 22 pounds. Asriel just kept growing, 1200 pounds, 2100 pounds, 4900 pounds... at the end of the month Asriel weighed over 300 million pounds.
14223.title: exponential gain

choices: Call for help, someone must know how to stop this.
Succumb to the addiction, keep growing.
142232.content:
Now over a thousand feet wide, the massive blob was fascinated by his gains, sure, some things had gotten harder, especially with his limbs completely sunken in thousands of tons of lard. Even his face was completely surrounded by a couple of thousand ton cheeks and equally massive neck rolls, which obscured most of his field of view.
It was not all bad though, younger monsters loved playing on the soft plains of his belly, climbing and hiding is his rolls, and many of the older ones helped feeding him and chatting whenever his mouth was not stuffed with food (which was rather rare)

Still he was not satisfied, knowing how much bigger he could get, he asked one of the monsters, Snowdin's former shopkeeper, to bring his spell book from the library.
The shopkeeper pried "What kind of spell are you looking for?",
"Ehm... I think I got a bit too big, maybe I could find something to slim down a bit" The boy convincingly lied.

It took a while, mostly because of the steep climb on the goat's deep fat rolls, but she found the book he wanted, she held it up for him to read, and found once again the same spell.
He chanted the spell while the shopkeeper was none the wiser.

Overnight his body grew, faster each time
300,000 tons...
600,000 tons...
It barely took a week for him to reach 19 million tons.
The heavier he got, the more he enjoyed his girth.
He was slowly becoming addicted to it.

Another week passed, now well over 2 billion tons and a couple of miles wide, he was now getting quite worried, as his cheeks grew, they were blocking more and more of his view.
During the 3rd week of the spell his weight was absolutely out of control, now over 200 miles wide, his fat was crushing buildings and structures on its way.

By the time the spell finally ended he was 161 trillion tons, he was starting to feel wet on his sides, as each side of his belly was spilling over a different ocean, the continent-wide blob could not deny he had loved every second of it, but he knew that if he kept growing he would crush the entire planet.
What could he possibly do?
142232.title: something else

15.content: You find the controls for Asriel Dreemurr. Which button do you press....?
15.title: Free Choice.

151.content: One more thing. Is he willing?
151.title: Force Feed

155.content: Asriel Dreemurr prince of the underground was spoiled by his parents with tons of fatting food. We start our story with Asriel is...
155.title: Start as Immobile.

info.brief_description: The goat boy from Undertale puts on some pounds. Or a lot.

A WG interaction story with Asriel as the main character.

Rules:

Can gain as much as you want. From chubby to the size of the underground and beyond.
Nothing sexual.
No disgusting stuff.
No vore.

Other than that, have fun
